Title: Sales Associate - Toronto, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Job Summary:
Walt Disney Studios Motion Pictures (WDSMP) has a Toronto-based Sales organization. This role is responsible for the management and execution of film sales for selected theatrical accounts and supporting the overall operations of the Canadian Sales team.
Responsibilities:
Establish, develop and maintain business relationships with exhibition circuits, theatre owners and film buyers for select accounts. Maximize and optimize our film releases in Canada, including French Quebec, with the use of negotiation skills, analytics and strong relationships.
Manage billings and collection of film rental and ensure accounts remain current.
Coordinate and schedule the classification of all feature films with regional classification boards.
Manage all aspects of pre-release & special screenings within Canada working with internal and external partners. This includes trade screenings, word of mouth screenings, promotional screenings, press and research screenings.
Analyze sales performance by account/customer.
Support Studio Cash Department to help manage daily cash applications.
Support the Sales team with entry and analysis of flash grosses and box office reports as well as monitoring program schedules, accounts receivables, payables, SAP Casual Buyer, etc.
Establish and build relationships with external distribution industry partners.
Basic Qualifications:
3+ years of sales experience preferably within the Entertainment or Media related Industry.
Current knowledge on business issues, trends and technological advances in the Entertainment Industry.
Strong negotiation and analytical skills.
Strong interpersonal, communication, relationship building (internal/external) and presentation skills.
Ability to work independently and manage a variety of initiatives/issues simultaneously.
Manage projects while dealing effectively with pressure and short timelines.
Ability to work well in a team environment.
Bilingual - French/English fluency is an asset.
Proficiency in studio-based systems, as well as third-party systems like ComScore and Webedia
Maintain standards of strict confidentiality with respect to all matters and documents.
Experience with SAP and AP/AR activities is an asset.
Strong computer proficiency with Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook.
Ability to travel as required.
Required Education
University Degree preferably with a Business focus or equivalent.
Additional Information:
Our Company proudly provides equal employment opportunity for all employees and applicants. We welcome and encourage applications from persons with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in any aspect of the selection process.

Title: Cashier/Customer Service - Whistler, BC - Indeed.com
Description:
Peaked Pies
is looking for it's newest part or full time Pie Agents to join our team.
We have built a reputation for incredibly tasty pies and well-trained staff. Our team is known for giving excellent service to our guests.
We treat our guests as friends and love to find out about their day. Behind the scenes we work hard and have fun as a team to ensure the highest quality pies are being made.
As a Pie Agent you are the first impression for our guests. You will have a friendly smile, engaging attitude and a love for Aussie Meat or Sweet pies, freshly made coffee and people. You will have previous experience in customer service, an outgoing personality, impeccable eye for detail and the ability to multitask.
PT / FT Staff Meal:
Free Pie and Coffee!
Shifts Available Are:
7:00am to 3:30pm or 1pm to Close.
Full Time Staff Incentives:
Ski Pass contribution, Extended Healthcare, ongoing training and room for advancement.
Full Time staff starting wage: $16.00 per hour, plus tips (average of $5.50 / hr)
Total Full Time Starting Wage: $21.50
Part Time staff starting wage: $15.20 per hour, plus tips (average of $5.50 / hr)
Total Part Time Starting Wage: $20.70 / hr
Peaked Pies
is committed to rewarding their staff for exceptional performance. The more responsibility you take on, the more you get paid.
Duties:
- Introduce your self to customers, get their name and accurately take their order.
- Cash handling
- Assembling the order correctly including making coffees/hot beverages
- Multitasking when busy; putting together orders, bussing the restaurant while communicating with the kitchen
- Inventory control of pies & toppings to ensure stocks are adequate for the time of day
- Handling Freshly Baked Pies
- Cooking mashed potato, peas and gravy
- Flexibility to work either mornings, evenings or both
- Morning Shift Duties include: opening the store & helping to bake the pies for the day
- Evening Shift Duties include cleaning and closing the store
- All staff are asked to help each other out.
- Everyone helps with washing dishes, keeping the store clean and tidy.
- Restocking the bakery
We are looking for 3-4 awesome Pie Agents
Part-time hours: 16-24 per week
Full-Time hours: 32-40 per week
Work Remotely
No
Job Types: Full-time, Part-time
Salary: $15.20-$21.00 per hour
Additional pay:
Tips
Benefits:
Casual dress
Dental care
Discounted or free food
Extended health care
Flexible schedule
Store discount
Vision care

8 hour shift

Title: Caissier(ère), Cashier - Montréal, QC - Indeed.com
Description:
Vous ne connaissez peut-être pas notre nom, mais vous savez où nous sommes. C’est parce que Groupe Compass Canada fait partie d’une compagnie mondiale de services de restauration et de services de soutien, qui est le sixième employeur en importance au monde, avec 625 000 associés.
Vous nous trouverez dans des écoles, des collèges, des hôpitaux, des immeubles de bureaux, des résidences pour personnes âgées, des attractions touristiques, des sites sportifs, des camps éloignés, des installations militaires, etc. Nous sommes présents dans toutes les grandes villes, sur des sites de travail éloignés et ailleurs, faisant des affaires au Canada et dans plus de 50 pays où vous pouvez apprendre et progresser. Rejoignez-nous maintenant et mettez votre carrière en avant!
Imaginez pouvoir créer un endroit où les leaders de demain, les grands penseurs et les rêveurs se rassemblent. Joignez-vous à nous et sachez que vous facilitez l’apprentissage, la croissance et les découvertes pour d’autres personnes. Grâce à notre travail, les étudiants et les membres de la faculté partagent bien plus qu’un repas. Et c’est la raison pour laquelle cela est bien plus qu’un emploi.
Pourquoi travailler avec Chartwells?
Nous sommes un membre du Groupe Compass Canada, la principale compagnie de services alimentaires et de soutien. Nous préparons des repas pour la génération Z dans les campus de collèges et pour les générations des établissements primaires et secondaires. Nous offrons des programmes et des solutions de restauration qui répondent aux besoins uniques des étudiants d’aujourd’hui. Joignez-vous à notre engagement envers une offre de solutions responsables et pour une alimentation saine.
Exécuter les tâches associées à la caisse, y compris les transactions en argent, la vérification du tiroir-caisse, la remise de monnaie, le comptage des reçus de caisse et l’exécution des rapports de caisse.
Tâches et responsabilités essentielles :
Effectuer des transactions de vente dans les temps voulus.
Saisir toutes les ventes dans la caisse enregistreuse pour assurer que tous les achats sont enregistrés avec exactitude.
Suivre les procédures standard pour effectuer des remboursements en argent comptant.
Communiquer avec les consommateurs et gérer leurs plaintes de manière aimable et en étant orienté sur le service.
Être responsable de tous les fonds de caisse et des encaissements assignés en s'assurant que le tiroir-caisse est conforme aux normes d'excédent/de déficit de caisse.
Assurer la conformité avec les normes de service de la compagnie et avec les procédures de contrôle des valeurs.
S’assurer de la conformité avec toutes les exigences d’hygiène et de sécurité.
Émettre des recommandations, effectuer la vente croisée de vos produits et en proposer des nouveaux.
Qualifications :
Vous pensez être le candidat idéal pour devenir l’un de nos caissiers? Nous sommes engagés à embaucher la personne la plus talentueuse pour occuper ce poste. Voici comment nous saurons que vous réussirez bien dans ce poste :
Capacité à travailler dans un milieu dynamique.
Excellentes habiletés en prise de décision et en résolution de problèmes.
La familiarité avec l’utilisation d’une caisse enregistreuse est un atout.
Excellentes compétences en service à la clientèle.
Aimer travailler en équipe.
Excellentes aptitudes de communication (verbale et écrite).
Le Groupe Compass Canada est déterminé à former un main-d’œuvre et un milieu du travail diversifié représentant les communautés au sein desquelles nous exerçons nos activités. Nous encourageons à postuler et nous avons le plaisir de considérer tous les candidats qualifiés, sans égard à la race, la couleur, la citoyenneté, la religion, le sexe, l'état civil, l'orientation sexuelle, l'identité de genre, le statut d'autochtone, l'âge, ou les personnes nécessitant une solution d’adaptation.
Pour les demandes des solutions d’adaptation pendant le processus d’embauche, veuillez communiquer avec PeopleHub@compass-canada.compour obtenir de plus amples renseignements.

Title: Property Assistant - Alberta - Indeed.com
Description:
If you want to experience a challenging and rewarding opportunity, then joining the nation’s leading self-storage company is the right choice to make. With over 63 properties and over 40 years of continued growth and success, there has never been a better time to join a team where you can learn, grow and have fun at the same time. Public Storage Canada will offer you a stable career in a challenging and exciting environment working independently.
The Company
Public Storage was founded in 1972 and was introduced to Canada in 1979 and we’ve never looked back. With over 63 properties and counting, we are the leaders in self-storage, and if anybody asks, “Yes! You can move in for $1!” We invented this promotion!
We operate on three company principles:
Mission
:
To work together and be the business of choice for our customers, employees and shareholders.
Vision:
To be Canada’s leader in self-storage
Purpose:
To build a first class, meaningful and long-term relationship with every customer.
The Position
We’re looking to hire Property Assistants who enjoy working in a challenging environment to oversee all aspects of a self-storage facility. We promise:
Competitive hourly rate with annual merit increases
Full Benefits Program and Incentive Plans.
No late evening shifts
Location and Hours of Operation
Public Storage Canada operates its facilities in major urban centers in the provinces of British Columbia, Alberta, Ontario and Quebec. Most of our locations are conveniently located close to major highways and city intersections and parking is always free. Hours of operation are Monday-Friday 9:30am-6:00pm, Saturday-Sunday 9:30AM-5:00PM.
Requirements
Outgoing, customer oriented professional
Willing and able to perform cleaning duties and work outdoors
A self-starter who can work with minimal supervision
A good communicator with some computer skills
Reliable transportation and flexible to work at multiple locations
Open availability throughout the week.
Able to work independently with minimal supervision
Responibilities
Maintenance
Performs lock checks and general property inspections at least twice each day
Cleans and/or dusts doors, floors, walls, hallways, common surface areas, drive paths, loading bays, and tenant washrooms. Cleans spaces as vacated. Remove small garbage items left throughout property grounds (interior/exterior), snow removal from walkways as needed
Adheres to all company safety policies and procedures.
Ensures all safety equipment and checklists are properly maintained for each shift, fire sprinkler checks, draining drip drums, safety checklists, etc.
Customer Service
Always provides outstanding customer service
Greet customers in a professional and friendly manner
Understands and is knowledgeable about Public Storage products and services and communicates them effectively to customers to address their needs
Listens and responds to phone inquiries from new customers inquiring about storage or existing customer concerns or challenges, follows up on website reservations by reaching out to the customer via phone or email. All of this is done while maintaining courtesy and professionalism with every interaction
Sells merchandise and insurance, seeks customer online reviews and participates in other corporate marketing programs
Administrative Functions
Assists the Property Manager in reaching the facilities individual merchandise, occupancy and delinquency goals and promotes Public Storage best practices
Controls delinquencies through regular phone contact, notifications, including email and letters
Maintains manual and operations logs for petty cash, postage, merchandise counts, reservations, NSF cheques, etc. and completes daily bank deposits and filing as needed
Why Should You Apply?
Competitive Salary
30 Days of Training
Quarterly Bonus Program
Advancement and Growth Opportunities
Full Benefit Plan after 3 Months
Employer / Employee Sponsored Group Retirement
Saving Program
Employee Discounts
Yearly Merit Increases
Christmas Bonus up to $100
Thanksgiving Day Gift
Company Sponsored Summer Event
Company Sponsored Christmas Party

Title: Part-time Cashier (up to 24 hrs/week) Southwood - Toronto, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
The primary function of the cashier is to provide overall exceptional customer service for the Big Carrot by facilitating a pleasant shopping experience while processing transactions of customer purchases.
Responsibilities:
Provide excellent customer service by interacting with customers in a friendly, familiar and efficient manner.
Perform all transactions as accurately as possible, keeping debit and credit receipts neatly placed in the sections provided.
Ensure manufacturer’s coupons are examined and processed accurately.
Process refunds as per Cash Department best practices.
Bag groceries neatly and efficiently if required.
Prior to starting shift ,when possible, check for new products daily (especially in the Produce Department).
Notify supervisor of any customer complaints and concerns, price discrepancies, and equipment problems and/or tech issues that arise.
Update lost grocery file as necessary.
Return product and bottles to designated shelves when required.
Direct customers to Customer Service for returns, complaints, and other situations that warrant longer explanation unrelated to the cash front.
Assist other cashiers when free and as needed.
Arrive for the start of shift on time and ready to work. Remember to give yourself a few minutes to get settled and look over product skus and codes.
Make sure to follow posted schedules unless otherwise advised.
Perform closing duties which can vary from trash disposal to general tidy up as directed by a Cash Supervisor.
Observe the policies and procedures regarding store operations and the health and safety policy.
All other duties as required by the department manager.
Skills, Knowledge and Experience:
No previous education required
Previous experience working with processing cash, debit and credit transactions an asset
Enjoys working with customers and the public
Attention to detail
Remaining attentive, focused, and calm in an often busy environment
Ability to prioritize workload
Flexibility of schedule (weekends and evenings)
The Big Carrot is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities. If you require an accommodation, let us know in advance and we will work with you to meet your needs.
Only those candidates who are shortlisted will be contacted for an interview.
Please note only those individuals legally entitled to work in Canada will be considered for employment with the Big Carrot.

Title: Winter 2021-22 - Food and Beverage Cashier - Banff, AB - Indeed.com
Description:
Why Join Us?
We work and play in Canada’s most beautiful playground, Banff National Park, and you can too. Sunshine Village is the premier ski resort in Western Canada. If you want to be part of making our guests’ ski experience unforgettable and think a winter season skiing and riding on the best powder in the Rockies would be great too, then read on...
What’s in it for you?
A ridiculously cool life experience
Free ski pass for Sunshine Village and super deals at other resorts
A plethora of lively staff events all season long
Marvelous discounts on ski gear, food & drinks and transportation.
Food and Beverage Cashier
Position Details
Wage: $16.00 with Gratuities Included + $1.00 retention bonus
Hours: Full-time averaging around 40hrs/ week
Location: 1 Sunshine Village Access Road, Banff AB, T1L1J5
Description
Cashiers provide an outstanding experience for our guests. They are responsible for accepting payment transactions while creating a warm and welcoming environment. Keeping public spaces clean, well-stocked, and safe for guests is an integral part of this position. This is a physical position that requires some manual labour lifting and carrying.
Essential Functions
Provide excellent guest service
Operating the POS system to ring through the guests’ orders
Handle cash float, ensuring all money is accounted for and properly tracked
Accept payment transactions and complete accurate daily cash-outs
Maintain public spaces, including stocking supplies, cleaning, garbage removal, and Washrooms
Ability to answer guest queries about the mountain and operations in a friendly and efficient manner
Maintain a clean checkout area
Adherence to workplace safety and food safety/sanitation regulations
Other duties as assigned
Experience/Requirements
Passion for providing outstanding guest service
Previous cash handling experience with the ability to accurately manage a cash float
Energetic and self-motivated
Excellent communication, time management and teamwork skills
WHMIS training is an asset
Successful completion of Proserv alcohol serving certificate is required prior to commencement
This position includes a multi-area ski pass to Sunshine Village & other resorts, a staff event calendar for experiencing the Rockies, and free transportation from Banff and Canmore to Sunshine.
Can’t wait to get started? Great, because we can’t wait to hear from you! Apply online at skibanff.com/jobs/ and tell us why you’re the next awesome member of our team. Remember, we’re looking for people who will wow our guests, so start now and wow us. Sunshine Village is an Equal Opportunity Employer and we value diversity within our workplace.

Title: Winter 2021/2022 - Rental Shop Technician - Kelowna, BC - Indeed.com
Description:
Big White is seeking applications for Rental Shop Technicians for the 2021/22 winter season. Successful applicants will be friendly and outgoing, and have a genuine desire to provide a great experience for our guests. Training and certification will be provided in all facets of ski and snowboard rental.
Duties and responsibilities include:
Greeting customers
Assisting with customer sign-in and contract completion
Selecting and fitting ski and snowboard boots, skis, snowboards, helmets, and poles
Contract review and data entry
Maintaining a safe and clean workplace at all times
Inspecting equipment
Operating Sirius Rental software terminal as a cashier
Accountability for thorough completion of all rental contracts
Required qualifications:
Previous experience as a Ski and Snowboard Technician is preferred, but not essential
Excellent communication skills
Excellent organisational and administrative skills
Ability to work in a fast-paced work environment
Time management skills
Keyboarding and data entry skills
Professional attitude
Must be approachable, dependable and a strong team player
Must be able to deal with people of all ages with animation and with patience
Location:
The Village Centre Mall, Big White Ski Resort, British Columbia, Canada
Duration:
Start dates are available in November and December 2021. The winter season closes in mid-April 2022. Some positions are available for applicants who may be unable to stay for the whole season. Please specify your availability in your application if you cannot stay until mid April.
Wages:
$15.20 per hour
